evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: The ITT population is defined as all patients randomly assigned to study drug, regardless of whether or not any study treatment dosing is completed.
evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The ITT population will consist of all randomized patients who are randomly assigned to study drug regardless of whether or not any study treatment dosing is completed and successfully screened based on the ‘Screening Pass/Fail’ eCRF page.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: The ITT population is defined as all patients randomly assigned to study drug, regardless of whether or not any study treatment dosing is completed.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP matches Protocol text exactly. Original SAP added a specific clause about 'successfully screened', but Generated SAP is consistent with the Protocol source of truth.

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: The PP population is defined as all randomly assigned patients who have at least one response evaluation after receiving at least one full dose... and who do not have any major protocol deviation.
evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The PP population will consist of all randomly assigned patients who have at least one response evaluation after receiving at least one full dose... and who do not have any major protocol deviations
evaluation_table.protocol_text: The PP population is defined as all randomly assigned patients who have at least one response evaluation after receiving at least one full dose... and who do not have any major protocol deviation.

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: The PK population is defined as all patients who receive at least one full dose of study drug... and who have at least one post treatment PK result.
evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The PK population will consist of all randomly assigned patients who receive at least one full dose... and who have at least one post treatment PK result.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: The PK population is defined as all patients who receive at least one full dose... and who have at least one post treatment PK result.

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: The safety population is defined as all randomly assigned patients who receive at least one dose (full or partial) of study drug
evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The safety population will consist of all randomly assigned patients who receive at least one dose (partial or full) of study drug
evaluation_table.protocol_text: The safety population is defined as all randomly assigned patients who receive at least one dose (full or partial) of study drug

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Defined as the last non-missing observation... recorded prior to the First Dose Date.
evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The baseline value for all analyses will be the last non-missing value prior to the first infusion unless otherwise specified.

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Calculated as (Last Dose Date – First Dose Date) + 1.
evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Actual duration of dose (weeks) = (Start Date of Last Cycle + 21 – Start Date of First Cycle) / 7
evaluation_table.reasoning: Original SAP explicitly defines duration of dose to include the full cycle length of the last dose (+21 days). Generated SAP defines it as the simple difference between administration dates (+1 day). This underestimates exposure duration by approximately 3 weeks compared to the Original SAP method.

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Time from the first documented response (CR or PR) until the first documentation of PD or death (among responders only).
evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Response duration... defined as the time between the initial response (CR or PR) that is confirmed... and PD/recurrence or death from any cause
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Response duration: the time between initial response (CR or PR) and PD/recurrence
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP correctly identifies that the definition was updated in the Original SAP (Section 12) to include 'death', differing from the Protocol.

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Time from randomization until the first documentation of PD (per RECIST v.1.1) or death due to any cause.
evaluation_table.original_sap_text: PFS is defined as time from randomization to determined PD/recurrence or death from any cause (whichever occurs first).
evaluation_table.protocol_text: PFS: the time from randomization until PD/recurrence or death due to any cause, whichever occurs first

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Time from randomization until the first documentation of PD.
evaluation_table.original_sap_text: TTP is defined as time from randomization to determined PD/recurrence.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: TTP: the time from randomization until PD/recurrence

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Time from randomization until death due to any cause.
evaluation_table.original_sap_text: OS is defined as time from randomization to death from any cause.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: OS: the time from randomization until death due to any cause

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Calculated as the integer part of (Date of Informed Consent – Date of Birth) / 365.25.
evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Age will be automatically calculated in the eCRF system based on the informed consent signed date, the year of birth and information on whether the date of birth has passed or not.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Standard calculation method matches intent of Original SAP.

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: For assessments on or after Study Day 1: Study Day = (Date of Assessment – Study Day 1 Date) + 1... There is no Study Day 0.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Standard CDISC/ADaM definition added for clarity.

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Defined as a post-baseline value that represents a worsening from baseline (either an increase in CTCAE grade or a shift from Normal/Low to High, or Normal/High to Low).
evaluation_table.original_sap_text: A shift table will be also produced... to detect changes from baseline.
evaluation_table.reasoning: Consistent with Original SAP's requirement for shift tables.

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: The date on which a patient receives the first administration of any component of the study treatment
The date of the last administration of any component of the study treatment
Defined as a patient achieving a Best Overall Response (BOR) of Complete Response (CR), Partial Response (PR), or Stable Disease (SD) as assessed at the end of Cycle 6
evaluation_table.original_sap_text: patients with controlled disease (complete response (CR), partial response (PR), or stable disease (SD), assessed at the end of Cycle 6)
evaluation_table.protocol_text: patients with controlled disease (complete response [CR], partial response [PR], or stable disease [SD], assessed at the end of Cycle 6)

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Defined as the period from Study Day 1 through the day before the first dose of monotherapy in the Maintenance Study Period, or until the EOT visit
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP operationalizes the protocol definition into specific dates.

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Defined as the period from the First Dose Date for the Maintenance Study Period through the date of the EOT visit.
evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Maintenance Study Period: until disease progression, or intolerable toxicity
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Maintenance Study Period: until disease progression, or intolerable toxicity
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP operationalizes the protocol definition into specific dates.

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Defined as the period beginning the day after the EOT visit until the date of death, withdrawal of consent, or the end of the study
evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Follow-Up Period: up to approximately 3 years from the last patient enrolled
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Follow-Up Period: up to approximately 3 years from the last patient enrolled
evaluation_table.reasoning: Generated SAP operationalizes the protocol definition into specific dates.

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: defined as the proportion of patients achieving a Best Overall Response (BOR) of either Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR)
evaluation_table.original_sap_text: The ORR is defined as the proportion of patients with a confirmed BOR of CR or PR
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Objective response rate (ORR, %) based on BOR during the Induction Study Period

evaluation_table.generated_sap_text: Defined as the period from the First Visit Date (ICF signature) to the day before the First Dose Date.
evaluation_table.original_sap_text: Screening evaluations will be completed within 28 days prior to randomization.
evaluation_table.protocol_text: Screening evaluations will be completed within 28 days prior to randomization.

additions.generated_sap_text: The date on which the patient signed the informed consent form (ICF).
The date of the last study-related contact with the patient
Defined as the First Dose Date

missing_definitions.original_sap_text: A prior medication is defined as any medication where both the start and stop dates are before the date of first infusion.
missing_definitions.reasoning: Essential definition for safety analysis found in Original SAP but missing in Generated SAP.

missing_definitions.original_sap_text: A concomitant medication is defined as any medication that has a stop date that is on or after the date of first infusion or missing.
missing_definitions.reasoning: Essential definition for safety analysis found in Original SAP but missing in Generated SAP.

missing_definitions.original_sap_text: A Treatment-Emergent Adverse Event (TEAE) is defined as any event not present before exposure to study drug or any event already present that worsens in either severity or frequency after exposure to study drug.
missing_definitions.protocol_text: A treatment-emergent AE is defined as any event not present before exposure to study drug or any event already present that worsens in either severity or frequency after exposure to study drug.
missing_definitions.reasoning: Critical safety definition present in both Protocol and Original SAP is missing from the Key Definitions section of Generated SAP.

missing_definitions.original_sap_text: administered dose intensity (weight-adjusted administered dose / actual duration of dose)... relative dose intensity (administered dose intensity / planned dose intensity * 100)
missing_definitions.reasoning: Specific calculation formulas for exposure analysis are missing.

issues.source_text: Actual duration of dose (weeks) = (Start Date of Last Cycle + 21 – Start Date of First Cycle) / 7
issues.generated_text: Calculated as (Last Dose Date – First Dose Date) + 1
issues.why_they_conflict: Original SAP includes the full duration of the last cycle (+21 days) in the calculation, whereas Generated SAP only calculates the time between the first and last administration dates. This results in a discrepancy of approximately 3 weeks in exposure duration.
issues.description: Calculation method for treatment duration differs significantly from Original SAP.
issues.reasoning: The Original SAP has a specific formula for 'Actual duration of dose' used for dose intensity that accounts for the therapeutic coverage of the last dose. The Generated SAP uses a generic duration formula that underestimates this coverage.

reasoning: The Generated SAP provides a solid set of definitions for populations, study periods, and efficacy endpoints, correctly incorporating the Protocol amendment regarding 'Response Duration' (including death) found in the Original SAP. However, it misses several standard definitions present in the Original SAP, such as Prior/Concomitant medications and TEAEs (though TEAEs are implied in analysis sections). A minor contradiction exists in the 'Duration of Treatment' calculation, where the Generated SAP uses a simple date difference while the Original SAP explicitly adds 21 days to account for the final cycle's duration. The ITT population definition in the Generated SAP matches the Protocol exactly, omitting a specific 'successfully screened' clause added in the Original SAP, which is acceptable.
summary: The Key Definitions section is decent, correctly capturing populations and efficacy endpoints consistent with the Protocol and Original SAP updates. However, it lacks explicit definitions for Prior/Concomitant medications and TEAEs, and the 'Duration of Treatment' calculation conflicts with the Original SAP's specific logic for dose intensity.
